display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 340px; max-width: 240px; width: 240px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.p: This Method is used to create pure UDP P2P Connection between to Machines behind NAT.

One of the biggest problems with P2P communication today is NAT. You can use this method you can get you external's IP address and Port that your NAT assigned to you, and then you can use it to communicate directly with other machines.
This Method can be used for a various of applications, from Instant Massaging, Video Calls, WalkieTalkie and much more.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 210px; max-width: 530px; width: 530px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: 1. The Clients send's acknowledge message to echo server.
2. The Server save the client'sÂ external IP and PORT in database, then it sends the client the list of all clients that are connected.
3. The Client can now open Direct P2P UDP connection with other Clients.
** The Echo Server can send the client is own external's IP and PORT, then he can send it to another Database.
